com.projectBackEnd.rest

Class WorkerResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.projectBackEnd.rest.WorkerResource

  • @ApplicationScoped
 @Path(value="workers")
 @Produces(value="application/json")
 @Consumes(value="application/json")
public class WorkerResource
extends java.lang.Object
    WorkerResource class is responsible for the RESTful interactions with Worker objects. This class uses Jax-rs to create java methods that can be mapped to HTTP methods. The HTTP methods that interact with this class allow for CRUD operations to be performed on the Worker objects over HTTP.
    Author:
    Gary Connelly

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WorkerResource() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response create(Worker worker)
      Allows for the creation of a Worker object on the database, using the Worker object passed in as a parameter.
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response delete(java.lang.String id)
      Allows for the deletion of a Worker object on the database, using the Worker object passed in as a parameter, and the id parameter to identify which Worker needs to be deleted.
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response getAll()
      Gets a handle on all of the Worker objects that exist in the database and returns them in a list in JSON format.
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response getWorker(java.lang.String id)
      Gets a handle on the Worker object, if one exists with the given id that is passed in as a parameter.
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response update(java.lang.String id, Worker worker)
      Allows an existing Worker object to be modified.

        public WorkerResource()

    • Method Detail

      • getAll

        @GET
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getAll()
        Gets a handle on all of the Worker objects that exist in the database and returns them in a list in JSON format. This list can then be consumed and read by any client subscribed to this web service.
        Returns:
        Response, the HTTP Response object containing the list of Workers.

      • getWorker

        @GET
 @Path(value="{id}")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getWorker(@PathParam(value="id")
                                                                       java.lang.String id)
        Gets a handle on the Worker object, if one exists with the given id that is passed in as a parameter. It then returns that Worker in the form of a HTTP Response object.
        Parameters:
        id, - the id of the Worker object that is to be returned.
        Returns:
        Response, the HTTP Response object containing the Worker with the given id.

      • update

        @PUT
 @Path(value="{id}")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response update(@PathParam(value="id")
                                                                    java.lang.String id,
                                                                    Worker worker)
        Allows an existing Worker object to be modified. Takes the id of the Worker to be modified, as well as a new Worker object that contains the updated information. The manually maps the existing Worker to the fields in the Worker that was passed in as a parameter, using the Getter and Setter methods.
        Parameters:
        id, - the id of the Worker object to be modified.
        worker, - the Worker object to be updated.
        Returns:
        Response, the HTTP status Response indicating whether the transaction succeeded or not.

      • create

        @POST
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response create(Worker worker)
        Allows for the creation of a Worker object on the database, using the Worker object passed in as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        worker, - the Worker object to be created.
        Returns:
        Response, the HTTP status Response indicating whether the transaction succeeded or not.

      • delete

        @DELETE
 @Path(value="{id}")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response delete(@PathParam(value="id")
                                                                       java.lang.String id)
        Allows for the deletion of a Worker object on the database, using the Worker object passed in as a parameter, and the id parameter to identify which Worker needs to be deleted.
        Parameters:
        id, - the id of the Worker object to be deleted.
        Returns:
        Response, the HTTP status Response indicating whether the transaction succeeded or not.
